hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2295
hadith_list.narrator: Zaid bin Khalid Al-Juhani narrated that the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w) said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Shall l not inform you of the best of witnesses? The one who comes with his testimony before being asked for it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2296
hadith_list.narrator: (Another chain) from Malik in which he said:

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2297
hadith_list.narrator: Zaid bin Khalid Al-Juhani narrated that the Messenger of Allah(s.a.w)   said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The best of witnesses is the one who gives his testimony before  being asked  for it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2298
hadith_list.narrator: Aishah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w) said:
hadith_list.english_text: The testimony of a treacherous man is not acceptable nor a treacherous woman nor a man lashed for the Hadd nor a woman lashed nor one possessing malice of enmity nor a rehearsed witness nor the Qani of (one contracted by)the family on their behalf nor the one associating himself to other than his Wala or to other than his  relatives."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2299
hadith_list.narrator: Ayman bin Khuraim narrated that the Prophet (s.a.w) stood to give a Khutbah and said:
hadith_list.english_text: "O you people False witness  is tantamount to Shirk with Allah" Then the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w)recited: So shun the Rijs of the idols, and shun false speech.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2300
hadith_list.narrator: Khuraim bin Fatik Al-Asadi narrated that the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w) performed the Subh (Fajr)prayer. Then when he turned  he got up to stand and said:
hadith_list.english_text: "O you people! False witness is tantamount to Shirk with Allah."Saying it three times, then he recited this Ayah And shun false speech Until the end of the Ayah.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2301
hadith_list.narrator: 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakrah narrated from his father that the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w) said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Shall I not inform you of the greatest of the major sins?" They said: "Of course O Messenger of Allah(s.a.w)!" He said: "Shirk with Allah disobeying parents, and false testimony." Or: "False speech" He said: "So the Messenger of Allah(s.a.w) would not stop saying it until we said ( to ourselves): 'I wish he would  be quiet. "

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2302
hadith_list.narrator: 'Imran bin Husain narrated that the Messenger of Allah(s.a.w)said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The best of people are my generation, then those who follow them,then those who follow them, then those who follow them."(He(s.a.w)said that) three times. "Then, after them a people will come who increase in fatness, loving fatness, giving testimony before they are asked for it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2302b
hadith_list.english_text: Another chain on the authority of 'Imran bin Husain narrates a similar narration.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2303
hadith_list.narrator: Clarification of this is in the Hadith of 'Umar bin Al-Khattab, from the Prophet(s.a.w) who said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The best of people are my generation, then those who follow them,then those who follow them. Then lying will spread, until a man testifies while his testimony was not requested, and a man will take an oath while an oath was not sought."
